alert.note: Alert for Phillips; Rooks; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 03 at 3:34AM CDT until April 04 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Dangerous Fire Weather Conditions Looking Increasingly Likely Tuesday Afternoon Into Early Evening... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR NORTH CENTRAL KANSAS AND SOUTH CENTRAL NEBRASKA AREAS MAINLY SOUTH OF A YORK TO CAMBRIDGE LINE... The National Weather Service in Hastings has issued a Fire Weather Watch for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Tuesday afternoon through Tuesday evening. * WINDS...Initially out of the southwest during the early to mid afternoon, sustained at least 25 to 35 MPH with gusts up to around around 50 MPH. Then shifting to out of the west and northwest during the late afternoon and evening, sustained at least 25 to 35 MPH with gusts at least 50 to 55 MPH. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 10 to 20 percent for a few to several hours, before steadily rising during the evening. * IMPACTS...Any fires that ignite may spread rapidly. Use caution if engaging in activities that could result in fire ignition.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
